Text.Value: oh god no oh please no oh no no no no no no no

EditorData.NodeContext: quiet muttering to herself in utter despair, feeling abandoned

Text.Value: But without the hammer, you can't take me anywhere. Find the HAMMER. Cross the HALL. Break my CHAINS.

EditorData.NodeContext: panicking and fretting. Emphasising the nouns on the instructions to make sure it's very clear what she needs the player to do

Text.Value: But you seem to have forgotten it, and now we're both going to die. Goodbye, it was terrible knowing you.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself as she rushes out what she fully expects to be a final goodbye

Text.Value: QUICK AS A COCKROACH LICKETY-SPLIT IF YOU DON'T MIND

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst of jovial chiding to hurrry the player along

Text.Value: WORST NEWS RAPHAEL IS ON HIS WAY HOME AND OH BOY OH BOY HE IS SPITTING MAD

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst, grimacing, not too loud, not treating this as the possible death sentence it is in reality, trying to make the situation seem less dire than it is

Text.Value: He'll have your guts for starters, and your soul for dessert. SOULS TASTE LIKE HONEYED TARTS.
Good news! You got what you came for - successful visit, great success. Fantastic work!

EditorData.NodeContext: Cheering herself up with the announcement of 'good news!'. Hurriedly delivers the positive verdict on our work so far.

Text.Value: But there's no turning back - you need to LEAVE. And you need to take me with you.

EditorData.NodeContext: urgent, intense, panicking a little

Text.Value: DING DING DING YOU JUST RANG THE DINNER BELL AND RAPHAEL'S COMING HOME TO FEAST
BUT YOU PROMISED

EditorData.NodeContext: shock, dismay

Text.Value: IT'S REALLY IMPORTANT THAT YOU DON'T PANIC EVEN WHEN YOUR EYES EVAPORATE FROM THE HEAT

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst, intense, attempting to reassurebut going aobut it very badly

Text.Value: Come to my prison, bring the Hammer, break my chains. And then we exit stage ANYWHICHWAY.

EditorData.NodeContext: hurriedly giving instructions in a bit of a panic

Text.Value: COME TO ME ACROSS THE HALL BRING THE HAMMER BREAK MY CHAINS

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst as she provides instructions hurriedly and with intensity

Text.Value: But you planned for this, I know you did. You have everything under control.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself, and calming the player

Text.Value: I'VE GOT GOOD NEWS. AND BAD NEWS. AND WORST NEWS.

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst, optimistic on first phrase, then a brief pause and the realisation that there is also 'bad news'. Downbeat. And then another brief pause and the announcement that there is also 'worse news'. Increasingly stressed. 'Worst' rather than 'worse' is intentional

Text.Value: BUT I AM ALMOST ENTIRELY CERTAIN I EMPHASISED HOW IMPORTANT THE HAMMER IS

EditorData.NodeContext: outburst of panic and frustration

Text.Value: Bad news - so many things will be on fire when you step outside of this room. YOU INCLUDED. That's okay, though, right? It's Hell! You expected it to be hot.

EditorData.NodeContext: running through the bad news as quickly as possible - trying to emphasise that this is fine. It's really not that bad. Emphasiis on 'YOU INCLUDED' is a somewhat panicked outburst, and she composes herself on the next line, reassuring herself and the player

Text.Value: Then we can get your contract.

EditorData.NodeContext: composing herself

Text.Value: I'm leaving without you.
Doesn't matter because it was the WRONG CRIME. You didn't steal what you came for.

EditorData.NodeContext: building toward an increase of volume on 'WRONG CRIME'. Then composing herself to deliver the last sentence

Text.Value: THEN YOU NEED TO MAKE IT BETTER AND GET US OUT OF HERE

EditorData.NodeContext: voice raised, imploring the player to keep calm when she can't

Text.Value: I'll be there.
I'm sure we've both made mistakes, and this would be a bad time to start blaming one another.

EditorData.NodeContext: extremely reasonable

Text.Value: You're making this worse.
Vandalism, thievery, murder, dawdling-with-intent. What crime did you commit?

EditorData.NodeContext: curious, listing out the only crimes she can think of, then asking gently which one the player committed

Synopsis: Hope spirit will stop players after they stole the treasure: something is wrong
